intro: Hieracium knautiifrons, commonly known as the Knautia-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are deeply lobed, resembling those of the Knautia genus, hence its common name. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators.
